dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Hi, I'm Alex from Almaty, and I'm really concerned about this new draft law on base stations. It feels like they're just forcing this on us.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hi, I'm Alex from Almaty, and I'm really concerned about this new draft law on base stations. It feels like they're just forcing this on us.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, the Ministry of Digital Development's proposal. Yeah, the one that would let telecom companies install equipment on rooftops without residents' consent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, the Ministry of Digital Development's proposal. Yeah, the one that would let telecom companies install equipment on rooftops without residents' consent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Ministry of Digital Development has submitted a large-scale draft law for public discussion that changes the rules in the telecommunications sector. One of its key provisions is the simplified installation of base stations on rooftops—even without residents' consent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. They're pushing for it to help reach that 100 Mbps internet speed goal nationwide, especially in areas with poor coverage.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. They're pushing for it to help reach that one hundred Mbps internet speed goal nationwide, especially in areas with poor coverage.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Authorities explain that these measures are necessary to provide high-speed internet (100 Mbps and above) across the country, including densely populated and newly developed areas where coverage remains problematic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But, you know, it's gonna stir up a lot of anxiety—I mean, radiophobia is already a huge issue in Kazakhstan, even if the science doesn't back up those fears.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, you know, it's gonna stir up a lot of anxiety-I mean, radiophobia is already a huge issue in Kazakhstan, even if the science doesn't back up those fears.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In recent years, Kazakhstan has seen rising concerns about radiophobia — the fear of base stations. Despite a lack of scientific evidence proving harm from such equipment, the installation of towers often sparks heated debates on social media.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And social media debates get so heated whenever a new tower goes up nearby. People are genuinely worried.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And social media debates get so heated whenever a new tower goes up nearby. People are genuinely worried.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite a lack of scientific evidence proving harm from such equipment, the installation of towers often sparks heated debates on social media.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The authorities are framing it as a public good, though—like, individual concerns take a backseat to national digital infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The authorities are framing it as a public good, though-like, individual concerns take a backseat to national digital infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new bill essentially treats telecom infrastructure as a public good, placing it above individual concerns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is a tough argument for homeowners to swallow when it's their building, their roof.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is a tough argument for homeowners to swallow when it's their building, their roof.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the only check is a sanitary clearance? That seems like a pretty low bar.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the only check is a sanitary clearance? That seems like a pretty low bar.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The only requirement is a sanitary and epidemiological clearance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, no budget funding needed, apparently. It's part of Point 39 of the National Action Plan from the President's September address.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, no budget funding needed, apparently. It's part of Point thirty nine of the National Action Plan from the President's September address.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bill is part of Point 39 of the National Action Plan to implement the President's Address dated September 2, 2024. The explanatory note emphasizes that the proposed measures will not require budget funding and aim to reduce digital inequality and strengthen Kazakhstan's role as a regional digital hub.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, aiming to reduce digital inequality and boost Kazakhstan as a regional digital hub. Ambitious, but controversial.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, aiming to reduce digital inequality and boost Kazakhstan as a regional digital hub. Ambitious, but controversial.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The explanatory note emphasizes that the proposed measures will not require budget funding and aim to reduce digital inequality and strengthen Kazakhstan's role as a regional digital hub.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Public discussion is open until June 5 on the Open NPA platform, so people still have time to weigh in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Public discussion is open until June five on the Open N P A platform, so people still have time to weigh in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Public discussion of the draft will continue until June 5 on the Open NPA platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I have a feeling this is gonna be a messy one. Balancing progress with people's sense of control over their own homes…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I have a feeling this is gonna be a messy one. Balancing progress with people's sense of control over their own homes...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's one of those policies where the intention might be good, but the execution feels heavy-handed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's one of those policies where the intention might be good, but the execution feels heavy-handed.
